summary: March 26 is the 85th day of the year  in the Gregorian calendar.
full_text: Nathaniel Bowditch  was an early American mathematician remembered for his work on ocean navigation. He is often credited as the founder of modern maritime navigation; his book The New American Practical Navigator, first published in 1802, is still carried on board every commissioned U.S. Naval vessel.
title: Nathaniel Bowditch
